subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] dictionary in lexical sets?
msgSnippet: ... There are QS letters (or letter + R pairs) for all the lexical sets. Just use an ASCII transcription of them, either QS-SAMPA or whichever else you please.
messageBody:
Paul Tremblay scripsit:
> While I am working on a QuikScript dictionary, I keep wanting a system
> that will represent phonemes rather than sounds. Is it possible to
> create a useful dictionary with lexical sets and letters?

There are QS letters (or letter + R pairs) for all the lexical sets.
Just use an ASCII transcription of them, either QS-SAMPA or whichever
else you please. It's just a matter of keeping straight whether
your symbols are being used phonemically or phonetically.

--
John Cowan cowan@... http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
Does anybody want any flotsam? / I've gotsam.
Does anybody want any jetsam? / I can getsam.
--Ogden Nash, No Doctors Today, Thank You

Paul Tremblay scripsit:
> While I am working on a QuikScript dictionary, I keep wanting a system 
> that will represent phonemes rather than sounds. Is it possible to 
> create a useful dictionary with lexical sets and letters?

There are QS letters (or letter + R pairs) for all the lexical sets.
Just use an ASCII transcription of them, either QS-SAMPA or whichever
else you please.  It's just a matter of keeping straight whether
your symbols are being used phonemically or phonetically.
